message.content:
Below is a concise, three‐part solution following the requested steps.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall Count & Layers  
  – There are two separate “sub‐structures,” each with multiple layers.  
  – The left sub‐structure (a little “house” with an arch) uses SIX blocks:  
     1) Two blue cubes on the bottom layer  
     2) One yellow rectangular “bridge” spanning those cubes  
     3) A red arch block centered over that bridge  
     4) Two orange triangular wedges forming a peaked “roof” on top  
  – The right sub‐structure (a cylinder base with curved red block on top) also uses SIX blocks:  
     1) One tall orange cylinder on the bottom  
     2) One large red “C‐shape” block (curved on top) resting on/around the cylinder  
     3) One orange triangular wedge on the ground next to/behind the cylinder  
     4) One green rectangular block stacked in front  
     5) One yellow cube and one blue cube beside/atop the green block  

•  Spatial Relationships  
  – Left “house”:  
     – Two blue cubes sit side by side (with a small gap).  
     – A single yellow rectangular block bridges across their tops.  
     – A red arch block stands above the yellow bridge in the center.  
     – Two orange wedge blocks meet at the apex to create the roof.  
  – Right “tower”:  
     – The orange cylinder (#13) stands upright.  
     – A red C‐shaped block (#3) is placed on or around the top of that cylinder (curved side up).  
     – An orange triangular wedge lies at ground level.  
     – Green, yellow, and blue blocks form a small stacked cluster in front/alongside.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTED BLOCKS (MATCHING THE DICTIONARY EXACTLY)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the dictionary indices required, respecting color / orientation:

A) Left Sub‐Structure
 • Blue cubes → Use index 4 twice (same small blue cube reused).  
 • Yellow rectangular “bridge” → Index 11 (yellow horizontal block).  
 • Red arch (front‐facing arch cutout) → Index 1.  
 • Orange wedges (forming roof) → Indices 14 and 15 (one for each half of the roof).

B) Right Sub‐Structure
 • Orange cylinder (vertical) → Index 13.  
 • Large red “C‐shape” block (curved indentation on top) → Index 3.  
 • Green rectangular prism → Index 10.  
 • Yellow cube → Index 6.  
 • Blue cube → Index 7.  
 • Orange triangular wedge on the ground → Index 16.

In total, 12 blocks are used.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1:  Move block with index 4    (1st blue cube, left base)
  Step2:  Move block with index 4    (2nd blue cube, right base)
  Step3:  Move block with index 11   (yellow bridging block on top of blue cubes)
  Step4:  Move block with index 1    (red arch centered over the yellow bridge)
  Step5:  Move block with index 14   (left orange wedge of the roof)
  Step6:  Move block with index 15   (right orange wedge of the roof)
  Step7:  Move block with index 13   (orange cylinder for the right sub‐structure)
  Step8:  Move block with index 3    (large red C‐shape onto/around cylinder)
  Step9:  Move block with index 10   (green rectangular block in front)
  Step10: Move block with index 6    (yellow cube atop/alongside the green block)
  Step11: Move block with index 7    (blue cube atop/alongside the green block)
  Step12: Move block with index 16   (orange wedge placed on the ground to the side)
}

That completes the exact set of blocks and a logical assembly sequence.
